doc:
J. W. Johnston https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._W._Johnston 0 J. W. Johnston (October 2, 1876 – July 29, 1946) was an Irish American stage and film actor who started as a supporting actor and, briefly, leading man in the 1910s and early 1920s, continued as a character performer from the mid-1920s, and ended as an unbilled bit player during the 1930s and 1940s. He was also an early member of Cecil B. DeMille's repertory company of actors, appearing in five of the director's features released between July and December 1914. Although J. W. Johnston was his most frequent billing, other appellations included J. W. Johnson, Jack W. Johnson, Jack Johnson, F. W. Johnston, John W. Johnston, Jack Johnston, Jack W. Johnston and Jack Johnstone. J._W._Johnston ( October_2_,_1876 – July_29_,_1946 ) was an_Irish_American_stage_and_film_actor who started as a_supporting_actor and , briefly , leading_man in the_1910s and early_1920s , continued as a_character_performer from the_mid-1920s , and ended as an_unbilled_bit_player during the_1930s_and_1940s . He was also an_early_member of Cecil_B._DeMille 's_repertory_company of actors , appearing in five of the_director 's_features released between July_and_December_1914 . Although J._W._Johnston was his_most_frequent_billing , other_appellations included J._W._Johnson , Jack_W._Johnson , Jack_Johnson , F._W._Johnston , John_W._Johnston , Jack_Johnston , Jack_W._Johnston and Jack_Johnstone .
